scenario_text.value: Aaaaaauuugh! Raaah!!!

(What was that?! Are we under attack? Is this
an emergency?!)

Oooooh, what is the problem?! I just don’t
understand it!
Shuuji?! What’s going on?!

Oh, Takuma. Phew... Remember how I asked you
for advice? Well, that loser’s the problem.
(Is he talking about Turuiemon?)

I don’t know what to do! He makes me so
upset.

And damn it, I don’t have time to be worried
about some personal problem right now!

(I don’t like where this is going. At this
rate, Shuuji is headed for more trouble.)

(I need to say something to encourage him,
set him straight. But what?)
How should I encourage Shuuji?
Frustration is good.
Did you stop yelling?
This isn’t working.

Uh, actually, I think it’s good that you’re
getting so frustrated.

Takuma, you don’t have to force yourself to
find some kind of silver lining here.

No, seriously. I mean, think about what it
says that you’re so upset about this.

It’s proof that you care enough that you’re
struggling to find a solution.
You think so?
I do. So don’t worry.

The important thing is that you just keep on
trying.
Yeah...maybe you’re right.

So, Shuuji, you have stopped yelling at the
little guy, right?

What? I mean, yeah... That’s what’s got me so
stressed out all the time.

Well, I think that right there is some pretty
good progress.

After all, you really used to lay into him
before.

What? No, I wasn’t really all that... Is that
what it looked like to you?

I mean, yeah, if I’m honest. But you’ve
really come a long way since then.

So don’t worry. The important thing is you
keep making progress and not expect too much.
Yeah...maybe you’re right.
Well, maybe this just isn’t working.

If it’s getting you this bent out of shape,
maybe you should go back to yelling.
What? No way! That’s not going to happen.

Listen, when I was growing up, my dad was
always really harsh with me.

Even looking back on it now, I can’t think of
anything good about that time in my life.

And yet I wound up doing the exact same
thing.
I never want to go back to that. Ever.
...Anyway, thanks, Takuma. Really.

Just being able to talk about this with
someone helps.

I’m going to keep trying to make this work.
See you around.
